Reason: The 'enablePngCrush' configuration is classified as performance-sensitive. This classification is based on the fact that when the 'args.enablePngCrush' boolean flag is set to true, the configuration triggers the instantiation and addition of the PngCrush post-processor to the list of post-processors during image conversion. This additional post-processing step for PNG files can potentially increase processing time and resource usage, leading to notable performance variations at the system level. The configuration directly impacts the execution flow of the image conversion process by introducing an extra processing overhead, making it performance-sensitive.
